content:
Where can I help? Its been a while since I've been involved in WG-CLI due to life but my company is giving me time to contribute to the Rust community and I want to take advantage of it to see clap3 released.

I've been digging into the pinned issues and its not quite clear what the next steps are

  • There are some renames. How decided are we on these? For any place with question marks, what is the process for deciding? Should I just make a decision and create a PR to discuss it there?
  • For enums, there was a blog post on this being implemented a long time ago, so I'm unsure where this is at now
  • For lifetimes, it seems we are now down to just 'help which sounds like was the goal. I did mention in it that kstring is an alternative.
  • For lib blitz, there aren't any problems identified. Are we still needing to do the audit and open issues?
  • For custom derive, it looks like this is pre-structopt. How much is still relevant?
  • For the rest of the 3.x tracking issue, there aren't associated tasks and its unclear what is expected.
@pksunkara I'm assuming you are the current maintainer; any direction you can give for where I can help?

@Ed Page Thanks, I am looking forward to your help. I am treating the 3.0 milestone as the single source of truth for all the remaining work in clap. The 3.x tracking issue was the original roadmap which I want to tick stuff off too so that I didn't miss anything.

I was in the middle of fixing "Remove inherent global settings" which is last item that needs to be done from the beta milestone of that tracking issue. But then, I realised that I needed to do a settings audit and gotten bogged down in it.

  • For lifetimes, after our recent conversation I have moved it 4.0. I would definitely love to give it a try and see what happens just before releasing 3.0 but to be honest, I feel like it's low priority.
  • For lib blitz, we still need to do an audit and I want to do it after all the feature work has been done
  • For custom derive, the issue is open because we don't have docs for those derives yet. All the feature work has been done. (There are quite a few other issues which deal purely with documentation and I definitely planned to tackle these after the settings audit).
  • For enums, I honestly don't have much context about that issue and will need to talk to Kevin to understand what his original intentions were. Which is why I was holding it for to be the last of the feature work.
  • For renames, feel free to write a comment there proposing any renames you would like. ? means I haven't come up with a good name yet. I will be extending that list as part of my settings audit. I created that issue because I wanted people to discuss them and propose alternatives if they want to.

enum subcommand is the next issue I wanted to tackle after the current work. I am not completely happy with the design proposed in that issue, so feel free to come up with a better design. Once that is done, I wanted to tackle vec types in derive which is a very interesting feature to work on.

I would greatly appreciate if you could spearhead those 2 issues. What do you think?

Sure! I'll start tackling them tomorrow! Feel free to assign them to me.

I didn't look for the milestone because of the pinned issues. Maybe we should unpin them and/or have the 3.x tracking issue link out to the 3.0 milestone?
Thanks. Added reference to milestone in the 3.0 tracking issue.
@Ed Page Thanks for working on this!
Hey, I currently have covid. Taking a bit of rest. Will get back to all of your issue comments by the end of the week.
Hope you get better soon! Worry more about that then getting back to me.
Hope you get better soon! :smile:
@pksunkara seeing you active, I take it you've recovered?
Yeah, replied to some of the stuff. Will catch up with the rest.
@Ed Page Just want to make sure that you understand what I am talking about in reference to this comment. I felt like there was a bit of miscommunication in there.
Ok, so not a should panic test but a test for that the error condition hits even when the flag is set to true
(haven't had a chance to dig into he rest of the comments today; been doing some bug fixing on cargo-release)
@Ed Page Do you think you can finish https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/pull/2677 in the next few days?
Yes, getting back to clap now after getting some other projects out of the way
Np. Also want to let you know that I am reading all your comments on issues tagged as 4.0 but unless I really want to reply, I am not focusing on them at all for now. It's for when 3.0 is stable.
